vyra_base.helper.logger module¶

class vyra_base.helper.logger.LogEntry(message, mode=LogMode.INFO)¶

Bases: object

Object for Logger entries.

debug()¶

Set the mode to debug.

error()¶

Set the mode to error.

message: str¶
mode: LogMode¶
warn()¶

Set the mode to warning.

class vyra_base.helper.logger.LogMode(*values)¶

Bases: Enum

Enum for the different logging modes.

0: debug-msg 1: info-msg 2: warning-msg 3: error-msg

DEBUG = 0¶
ERROR = 3¶
INFO = 1¶
WARNING = 2¶
class vyra_base.helper.logger.Logger¶

Bases: object

Class for logging backend information. The logger object is used globally therefore it is initialized only once. Like the OOP Singleton design pattern.

classmethod add_external(descriptor)¶
Return type:

None

classmethod debug(entry)¶

Logging a message in debug mode. Independent of the logging configuration, this function will always log the message in debug mode. This is useful for logging messages that should always be logged, regardless of the logging configuration.

Parameters:

  • LogEntry – Message and log level to be logged.. For more information

  • class. (see LogEntry)

Returns:

If logging is not active, the message will be printed to stdout. Otherwise, the message will be logged according to its mode.

Return type:

None

classmethod error(entry)¶

Logging a message in error mode. Independent of the logging configuration, this function will always log the message in error mode. This is useful for logging messages that should always be logged, regardless of the logging configuration.

Parameters:

  • LogEntry – Message and log level to be logged.. For more information

  • class. (see LogEntry)

Returns:

If logging is not active, the message will be printed to stdout. Otherwise, the message will be logged according to its mode.

Return type:

None

classmethod info(entry)¶

Logging a message in info mode. Independent of the logging configuration, this function will always log the message in info mode. This is useful for logging messages that should always be logged, regardless of the logging configuration.

Parameters:

  • LogEntry – Message and log level to be logged.. For more information

  • class. (see LogEntry)

Returns:

If logging is not active, the message will be printed to stdout. Otherwise, the message will be logged according to its mode.

Return type:

logger: Logger¶
static logging_on(func)¶

Decorator-function to log the name of the functions that are called.

The runtime duration of that function will also been logged.

Parameters:

func ([type]) – [function to be decorated]

Returns:

[wrapper function]

Return type:

[type]

classmethod warning(entry)¶

Logging a message in warning mode. Independent of the logging configuration, this function will always log the message in warning mode. This is useful for logging messages that should always be logged, regardless of the logging configuration.

Parameters:

  • LogEntry – Message and log level to be logged.. For more information

  • class. (see LogEntry)

Returns:

If logging is not active, the message will be printed to stdout. Otherwise, the message will be logged according to its mode.

Return type:

None
